item.title: Misc of package development
item.description: PAT: When personal access token expires, generate a new one and update: gitcreds::gitcreds_set() usethis::edit_r_environ() and check whether the PAT is new. Sys.getenv(“GITHUB_PAT”) to check whether the PAT is new Badge: license badge is just add the corresponding line to readme. R-CMD-check is just usethis::use_github_actions() Readme and vignettes: Everytime update, run devtools::build_readme() and knit readme.rmd and pkgdown::build_sites()

item.title: Create a blog post
item.description: This is a blog describing how to add a blog post on github.io. Contents are form Dr. Hofmann’s blog 8 instructions. Consider adding a link to your CV or other interesting project pages by modifying the setup/config.toml file. Here is a link to the page explaining toml syntax. Edit source/content/about.md to describe you. Add new content (if you want) using blogdown::add_content() Use blogdown::new_post("post name") to make a new post.

item.title: Using testthat and covr
item.description: This is a blog describing how to use testthat and covr. In your package, run usethis::use_testthat() to set up the tests folder. For each function, run usethis::use_test(“Rfuncname”). It will automatically create the corresponding test function for each R function. Add test block including multiple testing statements. e.g: context(“test-basics”) test_that(“multiplication works”, {expect_equal(2 * 2, 4) expect_output(function(x, y)) expect_length(function(x, y), 1)} ) Test packages using Ctrl/CMD - Shift - T or use the Build Menu

item.title: Use renv
item.description: This is a blog describing how to use package renv to facilate the running of github actions. Open project, remove all the packages will be used. Library renv, run renu::init(). Install necessary packages. Run renv::snapshot(). Push all the files to github, done. Pay attention to curl, it often suffers problems in github actions.

item.title: Create an R package Basic
item.description: This is a blog describing my first experience creating a simple R package on class STAT 585 at ISU. Basic Workflow Create a basic R package in R studio using New Project - New Dictionary - R Package Write functions in R/FuncName.R, including roxygen comments at the beginning of each function. Run devtools::document() to update NAMESPACE and man/FuncName.Rd Run usethis::use_package(“package”,type=“Import”) to update the DESCRIPTION
